properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 10:45AM EST until January 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning has been cancelled for the following river in
Southwest Lower Michigan...

Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County
Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County
Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County

.The crest of the Grand River is moving through Kent County.
River levels are falling elsewhere. A chance of snow changing to
rain on Saturday may slow down the rate of fall along the rivers.
The following forecast is based on observed and forecast 48 hour
precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River at Robinson Township.
* until Tuesday morning.
* At 7:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 13.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.3 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring and Minor Flooding is forecast.
* Forecast, the river will crest near 14.1 feet on Thursday.
* Impact, at 13.9 feet...Several homes in Vanlopik subdivision are
surrounded by water.
* Flood history, this crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet
on Jan 5 2020.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
